title: GIBE's HANDY GUIDE TO NORTH AMERICAN NUMBERING PLAN AREAs
historical_context: This article was published during the rise of phreaking culture in the 1980s, a time when hackers were exploring the telecommunications systems and exploiting them for free calls.
short_summary: This guide provides a comprehensive reference for North American Numbering Plan Areas (NPAs), detailing the geographic locations associated with each area code. It serves as a valuable tool for phreakers looking to understand and navigate the telephone system.
summary: This publication is not just a dry list of area codes; it encapsulates the spirit of the phreaking community in the late 1980s, where knowledge of the telephone system was a form of power. Gibe encourages readers to contribute additional information, fostering a sense of collaboration within the community. The guide reflects the playful yet serious nature of the hacking culture at the time, where such references were crucial for navigating the complexities of telecommunications. Overall, this article remains a fascinating glimpse into the early days of hacking and the importance of information sharing among enthusiasts.
